result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Dziewior III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay Sheriff's fees in the amount of $160.00
---------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No alcohol. No contact with the victim without the victim's and Probation Agent's consent. 
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before January 12, 2015 @ 8:00 a.m.

supervisions.notes:
with Huber privileges to commence forthwith.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------
Civil judgment entered against the Defendant for any and all unpaid Court obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert G Dziewior III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed
Application for Jail Time Credit form filed.

10:35 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Robert G Dziewior in court, in custody with attorney Francis P Raff.  
Matter is on today for a plea and sentencing on file 2016CF000331 and a sentencing after revocation hearing on file 2014CF000273.  
Atty Raff recites terms of the agreement as to each file.  
Atty Leusink makes record that the State is in compliance with victim's rights.  
Mr. Dziewior confirms the plea agreement set forth on the court record.  
Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Dziewior as to file 2016CF000331.  

GUILTY plea entered by Deft to Cts 1 & 2 of the Information in file 2016CF000331.  
Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  
Deft acknowledges  prior domestic abuse convictions.  
Plea questionnaire form  is filed with the Court. 
Deft givens warnings with regard to possible deportation if not a citation, firearms restriction and ineligibility to vote until civil rights are restored.  
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1 & 2
Question by Defendant with regard to no contact with his children.  
Response by Court. 
Court makes record and will accept joint agreement of the parties.  

There is a joint recommendation with regard to sentence credit.  
195 days dead time on file 2014CF000273
57 days dead time on file 2016CF000331

ON SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION FILE 2014CF000273 - Ct #2
Twelve (12) months in WCJ w/Huber privileges
195 days sentence credit
Civil judgment to be entered against the defendant for any unpaid court financial obligations

SENTENCING ON FILE 2016CF000331:
Ct #1 - Six (6) months in the WCJ w/Huber privileges - Conc w/ 2014CF000273
Ct. #2 - Six (6) months in the WCJ w/ Huber privileges - Consec to Ct #1, 2016CF000331
57 days sentence credit
Pay court costs
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

10:48 am  Court in recess.

Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Notice of Arrest

***AMENDMENT TO CONDITIONS 6/24/14: CASH COMPONENT REDUCED TO 200.00

Must post $2,500.00 cash.   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.R.B. OR HER PARENTS OR TWIN OAKS SHELTER.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
See signature bond set 6/22/14
